meaningMnemonic: 積もる is "to accumulate." Now you're doing the accumulating, and in order to do that you must go <vocabulary>to pile things up</vocabulary>. More and more and more. How do you know that this verb is when you're doing the accumulating? It's because you are piling up cows (む). Wow, a cow piler.
readingMnemonic: The reading comes from 積もる, so pile up your knowledge and remember it that way.
